title: 111_hr1204
content: The "Community Pharmacy Fairness Act of 2009" allows independent pharmacies to negotiate with health plans without violating antitrust laws. The "Community Pharmacy Fairness Act of 2009" grants independent pharmacies the same antitrust treatment as recognized bargaining units under the National Labor Relations Act during negotiations with health plans. Pharmacies are protected from antitrust actions when acting in good faith under this provision. The "Community Pharmacy Fairness Act of 2009" grants antitrust protection to independent pharmacies during negotiations with health plans. The exemption provided in subsection (a) does not subject pharmacies to criminal sanctions or civil damages beyond actual damages incurred. This exemption applies only to independent pharmacies excluded from the National Labor Relations Act, and does not change any provisions of that Act. The exemption is effective from the date of enactment and does not apply to agreements that boycott or exclude independent pharmacies. The "Community Pharmacy Fairness Act of 2009" protects independent pharmacies from antitrust actions that would limit their participation, allocate markets, tie products or services, or attempt to monopolize a market. This protection does not apply to negotiations involving a group of independent pharmacies with a health plan based on market share. The "Community Pharmacy Fairness Act of 2009" protects independent pharmacies from antitrust actions that would limit their participation in health plans. This protection does not apply to negotiations involving a group of independent pharmacies with a health plan based on market share. The Act also specifies that it does not affect the application of title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and does not apply to negotiations related to the Medicaid Program or the State Children's Health Insurance Program. The curr_chunk discusses various healthcare programs such as the State Children's Health Insurance Program, medical and dental care for uniformed services, Veterans' medical care, Federal employees' health benefits program, and the Indian Health Care Improvement Act. Definitions for terms like "antitrust laws" are also provided. The curr_chunk defines the term "health plan" as including group health plans, health insurance issuers, entities that administer services under the plan, and prescription drug plans. It also includes State laws similar to the Federal Trade Commission Act regarding unfair competition. The curr_chunk defines terms related to health insurance coverage, including prescription drug plans under Medicare and Medicare Advantage plans. It also clarifies the meanings of "health insurance coverage," "health insurance issuer," and "group health plan" as per the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The curr_chunk defines terms related to pharmacies, including the definition of an independent pharmacy based on market share criteria and the definition of a PDP region as per the Social Security Act. The curr_chunk discusses the 5-year sunset provision for the exemption provided in subsection (a) of the Security Act. It also mentions a study to be conducted by the Comptroller General on the impact of the enactment of this section. The Comptroller General will conduct oversight on independent pharmacies covered under this section, with no preclusion of oversight by the Federal Trade Commission or the Department of Justice.
